meanings.definition: The process of converting military operations or organizations to civilian control.
meanings.sent1: After the war, the civilianizations of the military bases began, allowing civilians to take over.
meanings.sent2: The civilianizations of the army camps were completed smoothly, and now civilians manage them.
meanings.sent3: The civilianizations of the military bases turned them into peaceful civilian hubs.
meanings.sent4: The civilianizations of the navy fleet transformed it into a civilian-operated maritime service.
meanings.sent5: The civilianizations of the air force bases made them accessible to the public for recreational activities.

meanings.definition: The act of adapting or conforming to civilian life or society.
meanings.sent1: His civilianizations after retiring from the army were challenging but rewarding.
meanings.sent2: The civilianizations of the soldiers returning home involved finding new jobs and routines.
meanings.sent3: The civilianizations of the former military personnel led to interesting encounters in civilian settings.
meanings.sent4: Her civilianizations included learning how to navigate the complexities of civilian bureaucracy.
meanings.sent5: The civilianizations of the veterans highlighted their resilience and adaptability in civilian life.
